Dr. Stephen Strange was a brilliant neurosurgeon and had a girlfriend,Dr. Christine Palmer. One day he picked up Christine for a night out for dinner, but ended up in a car accident that left Strange unharmed, but killed Christine.
After Christine's death, Strange, filled with grief, traveled the world in search of answers, where he metAncient Oneand was trained in the mystic arts. Strange followed a fate similar to that of hisEarth-199999counterpart, such as the death of his teacher, stoppingDormammufrom invading Earth, and becoming the Sorcerer Supreme, although he was unable to forget the past.
Two years after Christine's death, Strange couldn't help but think of the past. Even thoughWongsuggested that he accompany him before he did anything rash, Strange mustered the courage to use theEye of Agamottoto travel back in time before Palmer died, but despite his attempts to save Christine, his fate didn't seem to change. Shattered, Strange was visited by the Ancient One in the past, who explained to him that Christine's death was an "Absolute Point" in time, and that changing it would potentially end the universe, but a distraught Strange refused to let her go, forcing the Ancient One to try to stop him. During the conflict, the Ancient One split Doctor Strange's mind and body in two, one traveling centuries into the past, and the second half traveling the destined path he was destined to follow. Both halves of Strange would be oblivious to the existence of the other for the time being, coexisting simultaneously in the same timeline and universe.
Strange arrived centuries ago in time, meeting a fellow sorcerer namedO'Benghwho led him to the Lost Library of Cagliostro. O'Bengh informed Strange that no sorcerer had ever changed an Absolute Point in time, but Strange refused to listen. Finally, Strange found that the only way to break the Absolute Point in time was to absorb other beings to increase his power. During his first attempt, he failed to absorb a tentacled creature that lent him its power, but then slowly did so on lesser creatures and then on others with more power. Strange was frozen in time for centuries as he continually absorbed these creatures' energies. After absorbing the tentacles of the tentacled creature he first encountered, Strange became unfrozen in time and soon encountered an aged and dying O'Bengh, who revealed that Strange had been consuming the entities' power for centuries. O'Bengh refused to receive Strange's help and told him about the existence of the other Strange in this universe, who had accepted Christine's death.
When reality began to crumble due to the presence of Strange Supreme after he unfroze from time, an echo of Ancient One contacted the other Strange to tell him that he must stop his dark version, who was going to break the Absolute Point. As the good Strange prepared to stop him, Strange Supreme brought his good version before him to convince him to become one again to bring back Christine, but was rejected by his good version, and the two wizards fought at the crash site of his car after Strange Supreme brought them there. Strange managed to break the protection spell that the good Strange had and absorbed it.
With all the power obtained, Strange used his powers to successfully resurrect Christine, but the universe began to disable itself because he broke the Absolute Point in time, so his universe began to crumble. While trying to keep him and Christine alive, Strange sawThe Watcherand pleaded in vain to help him, willing to do anything to save the universe, but the Watcher refused, stating that any further interference with space and time would be disastrous.
His universe was destroyed in its entirety, but he managed to save himself by wrapping himself in a capsule using his magic. As Christine vanished in his arms, Strange questioned what he had done. In the end, Strange was the only survivor of his universe, and was left to tearfully apologize for the destruction he had caused.[1]
Some time later, Strange was physically visited by Uatu who sought him out to help him with a threat that endangers the Multiverse,Ultron.[3]
They assembled 5 different warriors from different timelines to form theGuardians of the Multiverse. WithCaptain CarterofEarth-82111,Star-LordofEarth-21818,KillmongerofEarth-32938,Party ThorofEarth-72124andGamoraofEarth-TRN908now assembled, they formulated a plan to steal theSoul Stonefrom Ultron to power Gamora'sInfinity Crusherand destroy hisInfinity Stones.
They traveled to a planet and would wait until they were ready to attract Ultron. Stephen was having problems to contain his powers. When Carter asked what happened to him, he simply replied that it was the same thing that happened to her:love. While they toasted, Thor accidentally attracted Ultron's attention with a flash of lightning. With Ultron arriving, Strange used the same protection spell his other half used when they fought on himself and the others.
The Watcher activated a portal to send the Guardians toUltron's reality. They fought briefly, until they managed to get the Soul Stone and then jump into the portal while Strange summonedZombiesofanother universeto keep Ultron occupied.
Arriving, theBlack Widowof that reality appeared and stole the Soul Gem, mistrustful of their intentions. As Captain Carter reasoned with her, as she knows aBlack Widowinher dimension, Ultron arrived to reclaim the Soul Stone and kill them.
As he used the power of the Infinity Stones to create a massive explosion, Supreme Strange used the Eye of Agamotto to contain it and bizarrely ate the explosion, absorbing its power. After being cut in half by Gamora, Ultron used his own Time Stone to revert it and freeze time, and tried to reclaim the Soul stone, only for Doctor Strange to intervene and reveal his ownTime Stoneto unfreeze time. Using as much power as he could, he, Thor and the others finally subdued Ultron, while Gamora obtained the Soul Stone and used the Infinity Crusher on him.
Unfortunately, this proved pointless as, due to the uniqueness of each universe, the Infinity Crusher couldn't work on his Infinity Stones, only the ones ofher universe.
As all their efforts proved pointless, instead Black Widow and Captain Carter used an arrow that contained the A.I. conscience ofArnim Zola, a plan Natasha andHawkeyesaved for Ultron until it was revealed he wasn't in their universe anymore. With their plain working successfully, Killmonger decided to claim the Stones' power for himself, only for Arnim Zola (in Ultron's body) to reveal himself, with both competing to claim the Stones' power.
Strange realizes they were never meant to win, and that the Watcher predicted everything. Both Arnim and Killmonger were sealed away in a pocket dimension, the containment staying with Doctor Strange in his prison reality. As the Watcher monologued on how dangerous it would be if they escaped, Strange replied he had "nothing buttime" and "what are friends for?" as he looked to the pocket dimension on his hands.[4]
Over time, Strange Supreme began capturing various heroes and villains from across theMultiverseand storing them in his Sanctum Infinitum, referring to these individuals as "Universe Killers". One of those wasKahhori, but she was somehow able to break free and escape to another universe.[5]In order to recapture her, Strange enlisted the help of his former teammate Captain Carter[6]and sent her to the world Kahhori was hiding on. After a brief fight between the two women, Strange teleported both of them back to his base, where he revealed his true intentions. He planned to sacrifice Kahhori and the other Universe Killers toThe Forge, which was intended to resurrect his universe so he could be with Christine again. Horrified by his actions, Carter confronted Strange, demanding he come to his senses. He claimed that she would do the same thing for Steve, which she adamantly denied and stated Steve would not even want her to do that. To deter Strange's plans, Carter used her shield to break out all of the prisoners, causing a massive fight in the Sanctum Infinitum.
Strange would later engage Captain Carter and Kahhori in a very long battle, and the former was able to briefly knock the demons out of him using theInfinity Stones. During that moment, she tried to convince Strange to stop the Forge, but he said he couldn't since his grief had grown beyond his control. His demons then entered him again and bloodlusted him to kill Carter, and they fought hand-to-hand for a few seconds before falling off the platform. Despite this, Strange was able to regain control and sacrifice himself to the Forge, successfully restoring his universe but causing him to never be born into it.[2]

The"Zombie Outbreak" Universeis an alternate reality where society onEarthcollapsed due to the outbreak of aQuantum Virus.
In 2017,Tony StarkinvitedPeter Parkerto be a member of theAvengersbut he turned Stark down.[1]
Ant-Manis infected
WhileJanet van Dynewas trapped in theQuantum Realmshe contracted aQuantum Viruswhich transformed her into aZombie. Years later, when her husbandHank Pymjourneyed into the Quantum Realm torescuehis long lost wife, van Dyne bit him and infected her husband as well. Using Pym'sQuantum Vehicle, the two returnedEarthwhereAnt-Manand theWaspwere waiting for them. WhenHope van Dynewent to greet her parents, Hank Pym attempted to bite her. van Dyne was able to dodge his attack however and Pym and Janet van Dyne infected Ant-Man instead.
Hank PymattacksCaptain America
With the virus infecting the entirePacific Northwestin a day, theAvengersandBlack Panthertook aQuinjettoSan Franciscoin hopes ofcontrolling the outbreak. But their attempted heroism only helped the virus spread further as all of the Avengers became infected while Black Panther was rescuedVision. Vision's reasons for saving the Wakandan king weren't altruistic however, as he planned to slowly feedT'Challato his zombified girlfriend,Wanda Maximoff.
The clothes ofWanda Maximoff's meals
Vision would also capture the zombified Ant-Man and successfully use theMind Stoneto cure his decapitated head from the virus, placing it under a glass dome once cured. He had previously attempted to cure Maximoff but was unable to due to her powers. Realizing how dangerous Maximoff is and unable to bring himself to kill her, Vision decided to keep her contained inCamp Lehighand sent out distress signals to lure in survivors so that Vision could feed them to Maximoff.
Spider-Man'sorientation video
Meanwhile, the Wasp would assemble agroup of survivorsconsisting ofKurt Goreshter,Sharon Carter,Happy Hogan, theWinter Soldier,Spider-Man, andOkoyewho came to theUnited States of Americain search of T'Challa. The group would eventually make their way toNew York Citywhere Spider-Man helped create aheadquartersusingSynthetic Webbingto suspend as series of train cars and buses high into the air. He would also make anorientation videofor new members of their group.[1]
TheHulktravels toEarth
Weeks following the otherAvengersbecame infected,Hulknarrowly escaped the clutches ofThanosand was sent hurtling towardsEarthvia theBifrost Bridge. Crash landing in theNew York Sanctum, the Hulk would revert back toBruce Banner. Finding the Sanctum deserted, Banner would steal a set of sorcerer's robes and put them on before heading out into the street.
Bruce Bannerwatches theZombiesfeast
While the street was initially deserted,Ebony MawandCull Obsidianwould soon arrive in search of theTime Stone. Getting ready for a battle, Banner attempted to transform into the Hulk but he refused to come out. SeeingIron Man,Doctor Strange, andWong, Banner was initially relieved until he realized that the trio wereZombiesthat had just infected Maw and Obsidian. The Zombies then attempt to attack before theCloak of Levitationswoops in and staves off Banner's attackers.
Spider-MansavesBruce Banner
While the Cloak is able to protect Banner initially, Maw soon used his telekinetic abilities to suspend Banner in the air. Just before Banner was about to be feasted on by Maw, Obsidian, and Iron Man, theWaspsummoned a horde of flyingAntsto eat the flesh off of the Maw, Obsidian, and Strange before decapitating Iron Man. Banner is then rescued bySpider-Manwho takes him back to thesurvivor group'shome baseand shows himSo You Wanna Survive the Zombie Apocalypse.[1]
TheZombie Outbreak Survivor Grouparrive atGrand Central Terminal
TheZombie Outbreak Survivor Groupincepted a signal coming fromCamp Lehighthat someone had found cure to theQuantum Virus. Wanting to investigate, the team headed toGrand Central Terminalto hijack a train. There the group split into three teams, with one going to hotwire the train while the other two guarded the perimeter.
Sharon CarterkillsHappy Hogan
The first team was successful in finding a train, but theWaspwas unable to restart the engine without momentum. This gaveSpider-Manthe idea to use hiswebsto create slingshot to give the train the momentum it needed. Elsewhere in the terminal,Happy Hoganwas attacked and infected by azombifiedHawkeyeforcingSharon Carterto kill Hogan. Meanwhile,Winter SoldierandOkoyewere attacked by a zombifiedFalconalthough Okoye was able to cut him in half with herspear.
Spider-Manholds onto the train
Successfully creating the needed thrust to get the train moving, Spider-Man held it in place until Carter, the Winter Soldier, and Okoye could arrive. As Spider-Man kept the train in place, a Zombie horde began to crowd around him. Luckily for him, theCloak of Levitationand the Wasp were able to keep the horde away from him until the others boarded the train. OnceBruce Bannerstarted the train's engine, the Cloak of Levitation flung Spider-Man through a window and onto the train.[1]
Captain Americais bisected by theWinter Soldier
While theZombie Outbreak Survivor Groupwas on their way toCamp Lehigh, azombifiedCaptain Americaboarded the train and attackedSharon Carter. Hearing Carter's screams theWinter Soldierrushed to her aid. Duking it out with his former friend, the Winter Soldier was able to disarm the captain, usingCaptain America's Shieldto slice him in two. While Captain America would survive the attack, he would fall off the train.
TheWaspbecomes infected
With Sharon Carter now infected, theWaspwould shrink down and go inside of Carter via her mouth before expanding, killing Carter. Due a cut on her arm being exposed to the zombified insides of Carter, the Wasp would slowly begin to become infected as well. Not wanting to risk their safety, the Wasp instructed her teammates to kill her but they refused.[1]
TheWaspsacrifices herself
TheZombie Outbreak Survivor Groupmade it just outside ofCamp Lehighbefore their train ran out of fuel. Needing to get through a horde ofZombiesto make it the camp, theWaspvolunteered to grow big and carry her teammates to the base before the infection fully set in. The Wasp was able to successfully carry her fellow survivors to base before passing out and becoming overwhelmed by the army of Zombies. The team is then greeted byVisionwho takes them inside.
TheZombie Outbreak Survivor Groupmeet a curedScott Lang
Inside, Vision informs the team that the Zombies are adverse to a frequency emitted by theMind Stone. He tells the group that targeted exposure to the frequency cure beings of theQuantum Virus, introducing them to a curedScott Langas proof of his work. UponBruce BannerandOkoyesuggesting that they broadcast the frequencyworldwide fromWakanda, theWinter Soldiersearches the base for a means of transport.
TheWanda Maximoffbreaks free
While searching the base, the Winter Soldier finds a zombifiedWanda Maximoff. He begins to shoot at her beforeBlack Panthertells him to stop. Finding him laying on a surgical table with one of his legs amputated, the Winter Soldier asks Black Panther to explain to him what happened as he takes him back up to meet with the others. Learning of Vision's true goal from Black Panther, the Winter Soldier confronts him before the Scarlet Witch breaks out of her containment and attacks them. As the group, alongside Black Panther and Vision, attempt to flee the base bothKurt GoreshterandOkoyeare lost to the Scarlet Witch.
Visionsacrifices himself
Vision briefly trapped the Scarlet Witch under rubble before informing the group of aQuadjet's location. Vision then ripped the Mind Stone out of head, killing himself. With the Mind Stone in tow, the remaining survivors rushed to the hanger housing the Quadjet, with the exception of the Winter Soldier who stayed behind to distract the Scarlet Witch who had just freed herself from the rubble.
TheHulkbattles theWanda Maximoff
This distraction was largely unsuccessful however as the Scarlet Witch soon flung the Winter Soldier off into the distance. Needing to buy his group more time,Bruce Bannerwas finally able to transform into the Hulk again, battling theWanda Maximoffas the rest of the survivors took off. While a now fully infectedWaspwas able to grab on to the Quadjet, the group was able to escape and they flew off to Wakanda. Unbeknownst to the group, a zombifiedThanoshad collected five of the sixInfinity Stonesand infiltrated Wakanda, infecting its populace.[1]
Doctor StrangesummonsZombies
During abattlewithanother universe'sUltron, aDoctor Strangefrom a separatealternate universewould open a portal to this one, dumping a pile ofZombieson top of Ultron.[2]Later, this universe'sWanda Maximoffwas kidnapped by Strange and taken to theSanctum Infinitum. There, Strange planned to use the Scarlet Witch, alongside other "Universe Killers", to power theWorld Forgeand recreate his universe which he previously destroyed. Alongside the other prisoners, she eventually be freed byCaptain CarterandKahhoriand returned to this universe.[3]

The Watcher mobilizes a diverse league comprising Strange Supreme, Captain Carter, Star-Lord T'Challa, the lively "Party" Thor, Black Panther Killmonger, and an alternate Gamora, infamous for slaying Thanos, uniting them under the banner of the "Guardians of the Multiverse" to confront the formidable Ultron, a relentless threat across dimensions.
Within Ultron's home reality, the assembled Guardians cross paths with Natasha Romanoff, joining forces to confront the omnipotent Ultron. A pivotal moment arises as Carter and Romanoff collaborate, using an arrow infused with Arnim Zola's consciousness to penetrate Ultron. Zola seizes the opportunity, obliterating Ultron from within and seizing control of his formidable body.
Unexpected treachery surfaces as Killmonger, driven by ambition, turns against his fellow Guardians, coveting Ultron's potent Infinity Stones for his own gain. A fierce struggle ensues between Zola and Killmonger for possession of the Stones, prompting an intervention led by Strange and the Watcher. Employing their abilities, they contain the warring entities within a secluded pocket dimension, entrusting Strange with the responsibility of vigilant oversight.
With the confrontation settled, the Watcher orchestrates the return of Carter, T'Challa, Gamora, and Thor to their respective universes. However, Romanoff steadfastly refuses to return to her original reality. Instead, the Watcher relocates her to an alternate universe plagued by the assassination of Avengers candidates, where her expertise proves instrumental in overcoming the threat posed by Loki.

Matt Murdock undergoes surgery in order to recover his sight. Some time later following the operation’s success, Matt is in his apartment where Foggy Nelson helps him remove his bandages, only for him to see Bullseye standing nearby, causing him to shout in alarm while Foggy seems unaware. When Bullseye prepares to attack him, Matt grabs a pair of scissors from his nightstand and throws it at him, only for it to go straight through him and impale Foggy in the chest, killing him. He then proceeds to see demonic versions of Karen Page, Heather Glenn, Gloria O’Breen, and his own father, sending him into a panic. Calling Dr. Jackson, Matt discovers that a powerful hallucinogen was injected into his eyes, and that the effects were irreversible. Descending further into a panicked mania, Matt gouges out his own eyes while hiding in the bathroom, rendering him totally blind. He hears footsteps and asks if someone is there as the Kingpin stands in the doorway, holding a barb-wire wrapped bat.

Victor von Doom watches a news report following the return of Reed Richards, Sue and Johnny Storm, and Benjamin Grimm to Earth following their journey to space, the four of them having developed super powers like in the Prime Universe. Doom deduces that something isn’t right and goes to face the Fantastic Four at the Baxter Building. Upon arrival, he uses a special sword to impale the Human Torch, obliterates the Thing with a blast of his gauntlet, and disabled Mr. Fantastic’s muscle control, leaving him to suffocate. Before Doom has a chance to locate the Invisible Woman, the Avengers arrive and subdue him and send him to jail. In his cell, he is approached by what seems to be a naked Sue Storm, who manifests beside him. When asked what made him think something was wrong with Richards and the others, Doom replied that Grimm wouldn’t be able to stand being seen in his new, monstrous form, and that he, as well as the others, had been replaced by imposters. “Sue” reveals this to be the case as she uses her abilities to send a force field into his skull, causing Doom to suffer a stroke, before revealing that she and the other three Fantastic Four members were alien organisms that had killed Richards and his crew and had taken their place. She claimed that by the time Doom recovered his ability to function normally again, he would be the last man left on Earth, before leaving him alone in his cell to begin her conquest of the world.

Tony Stark had lost Stark Industries to his rival Zeke Stane, and travelled to Antarctica to retrieve a biological weapon created by his father, in order to reclaim the company. Having lost contact with the first retrieval team, Stark went himself, along with X-Man Colossus and his partner Deadpool. Arriving at the facility, they discover the bio-weapon, Captain America, standing outside of the thawed-out bunker, freed from the ice that had previously housed him. Playing Rock, Paper, Scissors to see who would go out first, Deadpool lost but pushed Colossus out of the helicopter anyway. Activating his mutant abilities, Colossus prepared to engage Captain America, only for the latter to throw his shield at Colossus’s head, killing him instantly. Deadpool then jumped out of the helicopter to fight Captain America, chasing him into the bunker, while Tony suited up in his Iron Man armor. Making contact with Deadpool over the radio, with Deadpool frantically requesting backup, Iron Man entered the bunker and was horrified to see Captain America, his torso burst open and several tentacles emerging from it, consuming Deadpool’s body. Captain America states that Tony is much like his father in that they both made metal suits to fight him with, and that he would die just like him and that he should have left him in the ice. Fighting briefly with Rogers, Iron Man noticed the severed limbs of Deadpool fusing together and forming tendrils like those of Captain America’s and incinerated them with his armor’s flamethrowers, before Rogers threw his shield at his chest, critically damaging the armor and disabling most of its abilities. Captain America states he will take the helicopter’s keys from Tony and use it to escape, and that Tony would die soon because he couldn’t survive in the cold like he could. The two end up sitting beside a flare and wait to see what happens as a snowstorm begins rolling in, leaving their fates unknown.

Taking place in Paris, France, Viscount Raoul de Chagny and his men watch as Christine Daaé preforms an opera on stage, while an armed man watches in the shadows. The man, Frank Castiglione (this story’s version of Frank Castle), narrates how his wife Maria was a talented opera singer, and how the two lives happily with their two children, Frank Castiglione Jr. and Lisa. It is also revealed that Christine was Maria’s understudy, who was jealous of the latter’s popularity, and had Raoul and his men murder her and her children, leading Frank to lose himself in grief, condemning himself to endlessly wander the Catacombs underneath Paris. One day, however, he managed to overhear a conversation between Raoul and Christine, celebrating their success in murdering Frank’s family and undermining Maria’s success. Frank is filled with rage, and plots revenge against the two. Back in the present time, Frank cuts the rope that holds up the chandelier above Christine on the stage, causing it to fall and crush her, killing her instantly. Leaping from the rafters, Castiglione, wearing a skull-shaped half mask and black robes, then proceeds to kill both of Raoul’s men before the fearful Raoul is shot in the head by Castiglione, thereby fulfilling his vengeance.

Two children, Rickey and Marie, go to explore the abandoned and allegedly haunted Xavier Institute on Halloween, Rickey stating that his father told him that monsters used to live within, while Marie retorts that they were just “special people”, and that the only thing inside was hope. The children enter the building and begin exploring before the floor gives way underneath Rickey’s feet, causing him to fall into the dark lower floors. Turning on his flashlight, he discovers that he is surrounded by Constructs of the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants, who begin closing in on him. As he cries out for help, Wolverine suddenly appears and begins slicing through the Constructs with his claws while Marie used her telekinetic powers to lift Rickey up to safety, revealing herself as a Mutant. Hugging Marie, Rickie states that there really are monsters in the facility, but Marie reiterates that they weren’t monsters, but ghosts of people like her (Mutants). Looking over at Wolverine, the children ask “Trick or Treat”, and Wolverine grins as he says, “Bit of both, kid. Bit of both.” before he suddenly disappears, revealing that he was actually a ghost. The children see Magneto’s helmet where Wolverine was standing. Rickey asks what it is, and Marie replies, “Hope”.

In this reality, Wonder Man lives and becomes an Avenger. After a successful time on the team, he is chosen to become the new leader after Captain America leaves. Quicksilver is jealous of Wonder Man due to Scarlet Witch's love for him. Quicksilver leaves and is eventually killed in battle trying to save Scarlet Witch's life from Magneto. In turn, Magneto is killed by Scarlet Witch. Later Wonder Man and Scarlet Witch get married. In the second part of the story, Hank Pym is a resident scientist for the team and creates Ultron. Ultron turns on him and attacks the Avengers. Captain America, Iron Man, and Thor assist the team, only to witness Ultron kill Wonder Man. Ultron is shut down, but is used to save Wonder Man's brainwaves so he can "live." Scarlet Witch initially refuses, but accepts Pym's offer to "save" Wonder Man.

InNew York Citythe President and CEO of Heroes for Hire, Inc. woke up on the wrong side of the bed.  On his way to work, Danny Rand is harassed by bums, Spider-Man, and even his secretary, all asking for money.  So when he finally makes it into the office, his temper is short, especially when Luke eats the last donut.  Needless to say, he has no patience for The Silver Samurai asking for his help defending against Moses Magnum, but unable to pay the five billion required for the basic Avenger Package from Heroes for Hire, Inc.  Because of this choice, millions of Japanese people die at the hands of Magnum.
The Exiles arrive in Tokyo amidst the devastation, and Mariko is instantly heartbroken to see so many of her people dead and dying, and her hometown leveled by the horrible earthquake.  To make matters worse, the Tallus tells them they have to prevent the Japanese from being saved, condemning them to death.  Mariko refuses, claiming that she has to find her parents on this world and help them.

Illyana Rasputin was amutantwho went by the name Magik and possessed teleporting abilities as well as theSoulsword. She was forcibly recruited by theTimebrokerto join theExiles,[1]a group of six individuals from different realities who were in charge of chaotically influencing events across theMultiverseto prevent its possible collapse. Each Exile was motivated by the Timebroker with a revelation of a dreadful incident that would came to be were they not collaborative.[2]In Magik's case, she would either become unhinged from her time or murder her entire family.[3]
Magik replaced the Exiles' former leaderBlink, who was expelled from the group,[1]sparking tensions in the team. On her first mission with the Exiles, Magik emerged on a world whereJapanwas under attack fromMoses Magnum. The Exiles' mission was to kill theAvengers, something they morally opposed to. As the rest of the group chose to save the locals, Magik volunteered to brief the Avengers about the situation. However, she actually planned to accomplish their assigned mission. In cold blood, she murdered the Avengers, facing a version of her brotherColossus,[4]who unexpectedly defected and sacrificed himself to help her complete the mission.[5]Her actions caused the Exiles to jump to their next assignment. As a result, the Exiles' leaderMimicconfronted her over her unheroic attitude.[6]
In their next mission, the team had to preventCarter GhazikhanianandNicholas Gleasonfrom being killed byHavok, who had been taken over by the mind of analternate version of himself. At theXavier Institute, the Exiles clashed with theX-Men, who were unaware of the issue. As Ghazikhanian was hurt by Havok, the two teams realized they shared an enemy. Magik and her teammateSunfirewent toArchangelin order to use his blood to heal the injured kid.[6]Magik made an attempt to take Archangel's blood by force, but was outmatched and swiftly knocked unconscious.[7]Archangel took possession of Magik's Soulsword to join the fight against Havok alongside the Exiles and the X-Men. Magik regained consciousness after Havok was extirpated of the evil influence. As the mission was completed, Magik forged herself a new Soulsword.[8]
Over the following missions, Magik demonstrated such brutality to the point of worrying her teammates. In their next task, Magik and the Exiles were tricked byLord Crichton. Magik used her Soulsword to defeat thevampire king Captain Americaand hisAvengers, which caused Crichton to ascend as the new vampire king. He used a magic spell to disrupt the Exiles' teleportation and sent each member off to various realities for different periods of time. Magik was dumped in an ocean for a couple of minutes before being rescued by the Timebroker.[9]Upon reassembling, the Exiles were immediately sent to a reality where theFantastic Fourhad just been born. Their mission was to prevent any casualties. Magik cast a spell to shield the Exiles fromcosmic raysand assisted in defending New York City from a rampagingThing.[10]The mission turned out to be a disaster when Mimic, who had been infected by theBrood, during his time away led to Sunfire's death. Blink returned to the Exiles to replace Sunfire.[11]
